title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: When compiling a class from a subpackage using ajc, a new directory named "subpackage" is getting created under the existing "subpackage" directory.
EB: When compiling a class from a subpackage using ajc, a new directory should not be created under the existing "subpackage" directory.
SR: To reproduce the issue, compile a class from a subpackage using the command ajc -d . subpackage\Test.java
